snippet: The Patriots face a tricky lineup of games to open the 2016 season without Tom Brady, whose current backup is the second-year player Jimmy Garoppolo.
abstract: Four-game suspension for New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady puts team in difficult but not unprecedented situation; while Brady has quarterbacked overwhelming majority of Patriots games since 2001, he did sit out 2008 season with knee injury, leaving then-backup Matt Cassel to adequately helm team; assessment is offered of team's early-season outlook under current backup Jimmy Garoppolo.
lead_paragraph: The Patriots face a tricky lineup of games to open the 2016 season without Tom Brady, whose current backup is the second-year player Jimmy Garoppolo.

headline.main: Life Without Tom Brady? The Patriots Will Rely on Jimmy Garoppolo
headline.print_headline: Life Without Brady? For Starters, There Is a Precedent for the Patriots
